nml_option.name: config_SGH
nml_option.description: activate subglacial hydrology model

nml_option.name: config_SGH_adaptive_timestep_fraction
nml_option.description: fraction of adaptive CFL timestep to use

nml_option.name: config_SGH_max_adaptive_timestep
nml_option.description: The maximum allowable time step in seconds. If the allowable time step determined by the adaptive CFL calculation is longer than this, then the model will specify config_SGH_max_adaptive_timestep as the time step instead. Defaults to 100 years (in seconds).

nml_option.name: config_SGH_tangent_slope_calculation
nml_option.description: Selection of the method for calculating the tangent component of slope at edges. 'from_vertex_barycentric' interpolates scalar values from cell centers to vertices using the barycentric interpolation routine in operators (mpas_cells_to_points_using_baryweights) and then calculates the slope between vertices. It works for obtuse triangles, but will not work correctly across the edges of periodic meshes. 'from_vertex_barycentric_kiteareas' interpolates scalar values from cell centers to vertices using barycentric interpolation based on kiterea values and then calculates the slope between vertices. It will work across the edges of periodic meshes, but will not work correctly for obtuse triangles. 'from_normal_slope' uses the vector operator mpas_tangential_vector_1d to calculate the tangent slopes from the normal slopes on the edges of the adjacent cells. It will work for any mesh configuration, but is the least accurate method.

nml_option.name: config_SGH_pressure_calc
nml_option.description: Selection of the method for calculating water pressure. 'cavity' closes the hydrology equations by assuming cavities are always completely full. 'overburden' assumes water pressure is always equal to ice overburden pressure.

nml_option.name: config_SGH_alpha
nml_option.description: power of alpha parameter in subglacial water flux formula

nml_option.name: config_SGH_beta
nml_option.description: power of beta parameter in subglacial water flux formula

nml_option.name: config_SGH_conduc_coeff
nml_option.description: conductivity coefficient for subglacial water flux

nml_option.name: config_SGH_till_drainage
nml_option.description: background subglacial till drainage rate
nml_option.possible_values: positive real number. Default value is 0.001 m/yr in SI units.

nml_option.name: config_SGH_advection
nml_option.description: Advection method for SGH. 'fo'=first-order upwind; 'fct'=flux-corrected transport. FCT currently not enabled.

nml_option.name: config_SGH_bed_roughness
nml_option.description: cavitation coefficient

nml_option.name: config_SGH_bed_roughness_max
nml_option.description: bed roughness scale

nml_option.name: config_SGH_creep_coefficient
nml_option.description: creep closure coefficient

nml_option.name: config_SGH_englacial_porosity
nml_option.description: notional englacial porosity

nml_option.name: config_SGH_till_max
nml_option.description: maximum water thickness in subglacial till

nml_option.name: config_SGH_chnl_active
nml_option.description: activate channels in subglacial hydrology model

nml_option.name: config_SGH_chnl_alpha
nml_option.description: power of alpha parameter in subglacial water flux formula (in channels)

nml_option.name: config_SGH_chnl_beta
nml_option.description: power of beta parameter in subglacial water flux formula (in channels)

nml_option.name: config_SGH_chnl_conduc_coeff
nml_option.description: conductivity coefficient (in channels)

nml_option.name: config_SGH_chnl_creep_coefficient
nml_option.description: creep closure coefficient (in channels)

nml_option.name: config_SGH_incipient_channel_width
nml_option.description: width of sheet beneath/around channel that contributes to melt within the channel

nml_option.name: config_SGH_include_pressure_melt
nml_option.description: whether to include the pressure melt term in the rate of channel opening

nml_option.name: config_SGH_shmip_forcing
nml_option.description: calculate time-varying forcing specified by SHMIP experiments C or D

nml_option.name: config_SGH_basal_melt
nml_option.description: source for the basalMeltInput term. 'file' takes whatever field was input and performs no calculation. 'thermal' uses the groundedBasalMassBal field calculated by the thermal model. 'basal_heat' calculates a melt rate assuming the entirety of the basal heat flux (basalFrictionFlux+basalHeatFlux) goes to melting ice at the bed. This is calculated in the SGH module and is independent of any calculations in the thermal model.
